meanings.definition: Obtain money or property by deceit or fraud.
meanings.sent1: He was swindling people by selling fake watches.
meanings.sent2: The con artist was caught swindling innocent victims out of their savings.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox thought he could get away with swindling the chickens, but they outsmarted him.
meanings.sent4: Her smooth talking ways were like swindling the truth out of a stone.
meanings.sent5: The magician's tricks were so convincing, it felt like he was swindling reality itself.

meanings.sent1: The swindling of the elderly couple's life savings was despicable.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her history of swindling unsuspecting customers with fake products.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show portrayed a hilarious scenario of a swindling detective who couldn't solve any cases.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds in the sky seemed to be a visual representation of the swindling nature of the storm.
meanings.sent5: The swindling actions of the villain made him the most feared character in the story.
